title: mlflow run adds git version number for tutorial when run from local
body:
### System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**:
No
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**:
MacOS
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: 
both
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**:
0.4.2
- **Python version**: 
3.6.5
- **npm version (if running the dev UI):
6.1.0
- **Exact command to reproduce**:
mlflow run mlflow/example/tutorial -P alpha=0.4
### Describe the problem
After cloned the mlflow project to local, issued above command to run the tutorial. From the mlflow UI, the run command was appended with the git version number as follow:
`mlflow run /Users/wzhuang/mlflow/example/tutorial -v ba1f514617af26f9ebc1775af479fdaa78608269 -P alpha=0.4 -P l1_ratio=0.1`
Then tried to run it again with above command, exception was caught:
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/wzhuang/mlflow/mlflow/cli.py", line 112, in run
    run_id=run_id,
  File "/Users/wzhuang/mlflow/mlflow/projects/__init__.py", line 121, in run
    storage_dir=storage_dir, block=block, run_id=run_id)
  File "/Users/wzhuang/mlflow/mlflow/projects/__init__.py", line 49, in _run
    git_username=git_username, git_password=git_password)
  File "/Users/wzhuang/mlflow/mlflow/projects/__init__.py", line 192, in _fetch_project
    raise ExecutionException("Setting a version is only supported for Git project URIs")
```

I have done the investigation and will follow up with a PR for this issue.
